intro: Centaurea pallescens subsp. kurnubensis, commonly known as the Kurnub centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The plant features slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves, with bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a low-growing habit. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads.
